授業方法:
This course will be conducted face-to-face.
Depending on the evolving situation, course format may include the following:
- Individual, pair, and group discussion based on topics that relate to content
- Sharing of information, including weekly homework assignments, on Google Classroom- Presentation and homework assignments
- All components conducted in English
- As a level 2 course, all English tasks expected to be completed at an upper-intermediate level

第1回:
**The schedule below is an example of what the course will look like. Specific contents will not be decided upon until after a needs analysis is done (during first class) to determine the interests, backgrounds, and needs of enrolled students**

Week 1: Class overview, introductions, ice breakers
第2回: Week 2: Introduction to culture, discuss first 250-word journal
第3回: Week 3: Introduction to character and what influences it - a Japanese perspective; discuss second 250-word journal
第4回: Week 4: Canadian culture and characteristics, discuss third 250-word journal
第5回: Week 5: Cultural identity and mixed ethnicities, discuss fourth 250-word journal
第6回: Week 6: TV programs and how they change our thinking about culture, discuss fifth 250-word journal
第7回: Week 7: Introduction to final project, finding cultural sources online, discuss sixth 250-word journal
第8回: Week 8: Different forms of communication - English around the world, discuss seventh 250-word journal
第9回: Week 9: How to survive abroad - dealing with cultural differences, discuss eighth 250-word journal
第10回: Week 10: Domestic cultural differences - Kansai vs. Kanto, Eastern Canada vs. Western Canada, discuss ninth 250-word journal
第11回: Week 11: The university experience - comparing the lives of Japanese and Canadian students, discuss final 250-word journal
トピック.授業外学習2: Each class will involve information and topics that will need to be applied to a final presentation. It is the students’ responsibility to make notes during each class so they can successfully accomplish this. Each class, students will need to submit a 240-word journal based on discussion questions related to the topic. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments. Students will be expected to perform tasks at an upper-intermediate level.
